member.name: M:SimplySDK.SDKInstanceManager.HandleSDKException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Checks what kind of exception has occurred. For ValidationException with strings too long, throw InvalidEntryException. For other ValidationException, do nothing - no data binding in SDK. For SDK exceptions, rethrow them. For other exceptions, close the database, and then rethrow them.

member.name: M:SimplySDK.SDKInstanceManager.OpenDatabase(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Int16)
member.summary: Opens a non-Remote Data Access Sage 50 database.
member.param: File name of the Sage 50 Accounting database (.SAI).
Username to log on to database.
Set to true to open database in multi-user mode, for First Step databases, this parameter is ignored and always opened in single-user mode.
Name of the third party application opening the database.
Shortened name of the third party application opening the database - maximum 6 characters.
Version of the third party application opening the database.
member.returns: True if database if opened successfully.

member.summary: Opens a Remote Data Access Sage 50 database.
member.param: File name of the Sage 50 Accounting database (.SAI).
Username to log on to database.
Specify an optional Remote Data Access mode to open the database. If this value is null, the mode will be prompted for (through a ) during the opening process.
Name of the third party application opening the database.
Shortened name of the third party application opening the database - maximum 6 characters.
Version of the third party application opening the database.
member.returns: if database opened. if the database is not connected to Remote Data Access. if another database is already open. if the file and/or file path does not exist. if there is an error connecting to the database. if there is an error opening the database with default security settings. if Sage ID sign-in is required. if an unspecified error occurred.

member.remarks:
Accepted values:
For Canada
Alberta / Alberta, British Columbia / Colombie-Britannique,
Manitoba / Manitoba, New Brunswick / Nouveau-Brunswick,
Newfoundland / Terre-Neuve, N.W.T / Terr. du Nord-ouest,
Nova Scotia / Nouvelle-cosse, Ontario / Ontario,
Prince Edward Island / Ile-Prince-douard, Quebec / Qubec,
Saskatchewan / Saskatchewan, Yukon / Yukon, Nunavut / Nunavut
For US
Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware,
Dist. of Columbia, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas,
Kentucky, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi,
Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York,
North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island,
South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia, Washington,
West Virginia, Wisconsin, Wyoming, Puerto Rico

AlertResult.YES if user responds "Yes" to the message.
AlertResult.NO if user responds "No" to the message.
AlertResult.CANCEL if user wants to cancel the current action.

member.name: M:SimplySDK.Support.SDKAlert.CustomAlert(Simply.Domain.Utility.SimplyCustomMessage)
member.summary: Display a custom message in a dialog with 3 customizable buttons and 1 customizable icon.
member.param: A SimplyCustomMessage object that contains a customized message to be displayed.
member.returns:
1 if the right button is clicked (SimplyCustomMessage.Button1Text).
2 if the center button is clicked (SimplyCustomMessage.Button2Text).
3 if the left button is clicked (SimplyCustomMessage.Button3Text).
0 if there's only 1 button and we don't care about the result (there is only text in one of Button1Text, Button2Text, or Button3Text).

member.name: T:SimplySDK.SimplyErrorMessageException
member.summary: This exception indicates that an error has occurred.
member.remarks: Whenever this exception is thrown, this means an error has occurred. In order to override the default behaviour of this exception thrown, your application must subclass from the SDKAlert class and assign an instace of that object to SDKInstanceManager.SetAlertImplementation. The MessageForSDKDevelopment property provides which method to override for a particular error message.

member.name: M:SimplySDK.SimplyErrorMessageException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Simply.Domain.Utility.SimplyMessageId)

member.name: P:SimplySDK.SimplyErrorMessageException.MessageId
member.summary: Gets the message Id.

member.name: T:SimplySDK.AlertNotImplementedException
member.summary: This exception indicates that an alert message has occurred.
member.remarks: Whenever this exception is thrown, this means user input is required to continue processing underlying business logic in the SDK. In order to get user input, your application must subclass from the SDKAlert class and assign an instace of that object to SDKInstanceManager.SetAlertImplementation. The MessageForSDKDevelopment property provides which method to override for a particular alert message.

member.name: M:SimplySDK.AlertNotImplementedException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)

member.param: The method from which the error message occurred.

member.summary: Gets the message Id - MessageId is always informational.

member.name: T:SimplySDK.SageIdLoginRequiredException
member.summary: This exception indicates that Sage Id authentication is required before the requested action can be completed.
member.remarks: Whenever this exception is thrown, your application should explicitly invoke to initiate the Sage Id sign-in process. After the sign-in is successful, retry the operation that originally triggered this exception. If your application has set the property to true, then Sage Id sign-in can also be performed from within the Sage 50 application.

member.summary: Create a new instance.
